title: StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData
description: The StyledText component in Eclipse overuses the Font.getFontData API. Additionally, the FontMetrics API is also heavily used by StyledText. It is recommended to cache the metric information in StyledText and update it only when the font is changed. The default English encoding on Redhat 8 is UTF-8.
OB: When running Eclipse and using the Java Editor, a single keystroke can trigger the Font.getFontData API to be called 13 times. Additionally, this API is overused when scrolling the StyledText and selecting text. Each Font has 7 FontData, so typing the letter 'a' in the Java Editor can load 91 (7*13) FontData.
